SALESFORCE HELP
DOCS
VISUALFORCE B2B COMMERCE RELEASE NOTES AND UPGRADE GUIDE
Maintain Trust with Third-Party JavaScript Dependencies

Keep your storefront current with the most recent versions of the open-source JavaScript libraries used by the B2B Commerce Visualforce pages. This release updates several libraries used for rendering components and their behaviors. These libraries are well tested and their changes don't break any existing functionality on your pages.

Where: This change applies to B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’19 (version 4.11) in Lightning Experience and Salesforce Classic in Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer editions.

Why: The updated libraries include:

LIBRARY	VERSION	WHAT'S CHANGED?
backbone.js	1.4.0	Change log
backbone.paginator.js	2.0.8	No change log available
bootstrap.js	3.4.1	Change log
bootstrap-datepicker.js	1.9.0	Change log
handlebars.js	4.1.0	Change log
jquery.js	3.4.0	Change log
jquery.hoverintent.js	1.10.0	Change log
jquery.validate.js	1.19.0	Change log
NOTE For more details about the libraries, including licenses, see the help for JavaScript libraries in storefront pages.

How: After you upgrade the managed package, the updated libraries are available in the default implementation of the ccrz.cc_hk_UserInterface:v004 extension class.

If you previously extended the default ccrz.cc_hk_UserInterface class to customize the front-end libraries you're using, update your extension to reference the latest versions of these libraries. If you reference these libraries from other locations in your code, update those references, as well.

SEE ALSO
Default JavaScript Libraries for Storefront Pages
(Salesforce Developers) ccrz.cc_hk_UserInterface

title: Maintaining Trust with Third-Party JavaScript Dependencies
